item.title: Light pollution - flood lights, 13th February
item.description:
These lights are motion censored and shine in to 3 Glebe Road flats all hours of the evening, on and off every single time people and the overground go by. They aren’t up to building standard and are a total nuisance. Hoping the council step in and help.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glebe Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle parked, 13th February
item.description:

item.title: Littering from neighbour., 13th February
item.description:
Well, the neighbour has been using the back of the window/corridor as their own personal trash can. As you can see from the pictures, anything and everything goes. Wipes, diapers, bottles, etc. ongoing issue for a year now.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Howard Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Household items dumped on the pavement repeatedly outside the owners house, 13th February
item.description:
Residents repeatedly dump their unwanted household items outside their house, a collection not arrange. this pile has been there for a number of weeks now strewn over the pavement. I tidy up regularly but we have blind people in our community, it’s unsafe

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southborough Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree removed and replaced with tarmac, 13th February

item.title: Lamp facing wrong way, 13th February
item.description:
The pedestrian crossing sign has been turned away from pedestrians and is facing down Camden High Street! Pedestrians can't see when it's safe to cross and as there are so many tourists, it is quite dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kentish Town Road, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamp number 2 Outside 3,4 and 5 Blakeney Close, NW1 0BR, 13th February
item.description:
Light has been flickering and has now gone out. We urgently need it to be fixed as there is drug dealing in this secluded area and we're unable to see who is outside our homes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bergholt Mews, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
